file_content.text: I don't need to see you. Get out of here.
I thought we'd finished our meeting?
Get out of here. Leave me in peace.
I can breathe... I can breathe again. Thank you.
Alert: Life signs stabilized.
Warning: Any stress or exertion is inadvisable.
No more, all right? No more. I'll tell you everything, if you'll just--just go.
Finish your story, Tlan.
Start talking.
Just relax. Focus on what you're saying.
You'll be okay.
Right. Focus.
No guarantees. If you don't make me happy, I can always poison you again.
We'll see.
Yes. Yes, of course.
Like I told you, Synchet sold its medical division--VerveGen--to a group of men who kept their identities secret.
They were especially interested in VerveGen's genetic modification serums. They might still be running the company. I don't know for sure.
You haven't been in contact with them?
You don't know?
No. Haven't been and wouldn't want to. I doubt the other Synchet owners are any different.
Any idea what VerveGen is up to?
Anything else on them?
Not really. I heard something about a Cyclone trial--maybe the company's looking to produce and sell a new batch.
You better not be holding anything back.
Don't play with me.
I'm not. I'm not stupid. I'm not fighting.
VerveGen used to be headquartered in the upper levels. Don't know if you care... maybe the building's not even there anymore.
But whatever VerveGen and its owners are doing, I'm not involved.
I think that'll do. Thanks for all your help, Tlan.
All right.
Glad I could be of service. Now get away from me, and get out of my lounge.
I'll be watching you.
Glad to hear it. You rest up now.
Heh. Idiot.
You ever come here again, I'll be ready.
Alert: Scanning for weapons.
Warning: Visitor is armed.
Ignore the droids. Netula says you're persistent, but I don't know what you think you'll find here.
Synchet's gone--bankrupted by the war and sold off piece by piece for a tidy sum. Made me rich, but that life is over.
I've been wanting to meet you. Your old company has been linked to terrorists.
Master Tlan?
Master Tlan. You must've stayed involved on the side. Heard about Synchet and Cyclone.
You can't be entirely retired.
Master Tlan. If you're everything I've heard, you must've stayed involved. I bet you could tell me stories about Synchet... and Cyclone?
[Flirt] I can't believe that.
I can guess things. Doesn't mean my hands are in the basket.
I think you got rich by dealing with terrorists. What do you say to that?
Corporate scum.
I'd be more worried if I knew what you were talking about.
Besides, you're nobody to me. Why would I reveal confidential information to you?
I thought you might help a potential investor. It pays to know what you're dealing with.
I'm in business, myself.
That's all this is? You saw a business opportunity. Heh.
Maybe it intrigues a girl.
[Flirt] I think it depends.
You're playing games. I like that.
My masters want this matter sorted out.
I've got important employers.
And I should cooperate with them because...?
Do you really want to make an enemy of the Empire?
We run this galaxy.
The Empire? No... no, I don't need that kind of trouble.
Cause trouble with me, and I can make your life very difficult.
Resistance is a bad mistake.
Is that right? And how exactly would you do that?
How would you like to see your droids repossessed? Or sabotaged?
We can ruin your setup.
Warning: Visitor displaying hostile behavior.
Alert: Powering weapons systems.
Enough, all of you! You don't need to damage the droids. I'll talk.
I work with the Hutt Cartel. You really want to lose their support?
I've got gang connections.
I... see. Well, in that case, I don't want to anger my hosts.
You value your isolation; I can make you public.
"Organic contact," maybe?
No one can get in here unless I allow it. You're not going to let those breathing, sweating creatures into my lounge....
Huh. I'll talk, if it'll get rid of you.
Here's a story you might be interested in--a story about VerveGen, one of Synchet's subsidiaries.
I'm listening. What did VerveGen do?
All right.
I don't have anything better to do. Let's hear it.
Story time, eh?
Do go on. You've got my undivided attention.
[Flirt] This is working out.
This better go somewhere.
So is mine. And I'm the one with the battle droids.
VerveGen developed medical technology--mainly genetic modification serums. Not one of Synchet's more profitable branches.
When we put VerveGen on the market, we got some strange buyers. Paid cash and kept their names secret--took the company and all its technology.
Can you contact the buyers?
I need to find them.
I wouldn't know how. You could try yourself.
Oh?
Beats me. After the business sold, it wasn't my concern.
You gave dangerous technology to terrorists.
That was irresponsible.
Maybe. That's your concern now, not mine.
VerveGen's offices were on the upper levels of the city. So far as I'm aware, the old buyers are still in charge.
Now that's the story I promised. And if you found that intriguing, maybe you can stick around a while. It has been a bit since I last had company...
Sorry, but I've got to get to VerveGen.
I'm in a hurry.
That's a shame. I was beginning to enjoy myself.
I can spare a little while, if you can keep my visit a secret.
Sounds good.
For you? Of course.
You follow through? Huh. I'll wait outside with the droids.
Thank you for coming by. I appreciate the reminder of what flesh can do.
I'll let you be on your way--but be careful with VerveGen. They don't play around.
Not for all the credits in the world, freak.
Ick.
You're treading on dangerous ground, young lady.
You know how to leave them hanging, don't you?
That's all I have, and I think I've been more than cooperative. Everything clear enough?
I appreciate all your help, Master Tlan.
Yes, thank you.
Looks like I'm paying a visit to VerveGen.
Time to work.
I'll be watching you.
I'm sure you will. But don't press your luck.
You can see yourself out. Don't bother the droids when you go--and leave Netula alone.
Get out of here. I don't know you, I don't like you, and I'm not speaking to you.
